definitions.definition: (literary) Because, as, since.
definitions.example: I had to stay with my wicked stepmother, for I had nowhere else to go.

definitions.definition: Towards; in the direction of.
definitions.example: The astronauts headed for the moon.

definitions.definition: Directed at; intended to belong to.
definitions.example: I have something for you.

definitions.definition: In order to help, benefit, gratify, honor etc. (someone or something).
definitions.example: Everything I do, I do for you.

definitions.definition: To be used or treated in a stated way, or with a stated purpose.
definitions.example: This is a new bell for my bicycle.

definitions.definition: Supporting, in favour of.
definitions.example: Antonym: against

definitions.definition: Because of.
definitions.example: He wouldn't apologize; and just for that, she refused to help him.

definitions.definition: Intended to cure, remove or counteract; in order to cure, remove or counteract.
definitions.example: This medicine is for your cough.

definitions.definition: Over (a period of time).
definitions.example: I've lived here for three years.

definitions.definition: Throughout or across (a distance in space).
definitions.example: I can see for miles.

definitions.definition: Used to introduce a subject within a to-infinitive clause.
definitions.example: It is unreasonable for our boss to withhold our wages.

definitions.definition: On behalf of.
definitions.example: I will stand in for him.

definitions.definition: In the role or capacity of; instead of; in place of.
definitions.example: I used a hay bale for a bed.

definitions.definition: In exchange for; in correspondence or equivalence with.
definitions.example: I got five hundred pounds for that old car!

definitions.definition: In order to obtain or acquire.
definitions.example: I am aiming for completion by the end of business Thursday.

definitions.definition: By the standards of, usually with the implication that those standards are lower than one might otherwise expect.
definitions.example: Fair for its day.

definitions.definition: To be, or as being.
definitions.example: Don't take me for a fool.

definitions.definition: (usually in the phrase 'for all') Despite, in spite of.
definitions.example: For all his expensive education, he didn't seem very bright.

definitions.definition: Indicating something desired or anticipated.
definitions.example: O for the wings of a dove.

definitions.definition: (in expressions such as 'for a start') Introducing the first item(s) in a potential sequence.
definitions.example: Go scuba diving? For one thing, I can't even swim.

definitions.definition: (with names, chiefly US) In honor of; after.
definitions.example: He is named for his grandfather.

definitions.definition: Due or facing (a certain outcome or fate).
definitions.example: He totally screwed up that project. Now he's surely for the sack.

definitions.definition: (chiefly US) Out of; used to indicate a fraction, a ratio
definitions.example: In term of base hits, Jones was three for four on the day

definitions.definition: (cricket) Used as part of a score to indicate the number of wickets that have fallen.
definitions.example: At close of play, England were 305 for 3.

definitions.definition: (obsolete) Indicating that in prevention of which, or through fear of which, anything is done.

Used in various more-or-less idiomatic ways to construe individual verbs, indicating various semantic relationships such as target, purpose, result, etc.; see also the entries for individual phrasal verbs, e.g. ask for, look for, stand for, etc.
definitions.example: to account for one's whereabouts    to care for a relative    to settle for second best    to allow for mistakes

definitions.definition: (nonstandard) So (that), in order to
definitions.example: He took the swing shift for he could get more overtime.

definitions.definition: (nonstandard, in representations of dialectal speech, especially that of black speakers) To, the particle for marking the following verb as an infinitive.
